intro: Muehlenbeckia tamnifolia var. quadrangulata, commonly known as the four-angle muhlenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive quadrangular stems. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
